sections.title: 🚀 Introduction
sections.content: The Sentiment Analysis Platform analyzes user sentiment from YouTube comments, Reddit discussions, and real-time input using VADER NLP.

sections.title: 🛠️ Getting Started
sections.content:
To start using the platform, follow these steps:

1️⃣ Sign Up/Login
   - Create an account or log in using your credentials.
   - If logging in with Google OAuth, a random password will be assigned, which can be changed later.

2️⃣ Choose a Service
   - Select from YouTube Sentiment Analysis, Reddit Analysis, or Real-Time Sentiment Analysis.

3️⃣ Analyze Data
   - Enter the YouTube video URL, Reddit post URL, or custom text for real-time analysis.
   - The platform fetches and analyzes comments using Natural Language Processing (NLP).

4️⃣ View Results
   - Get insights such as positive, neutral, and negative sentiment breakdowns.

sections.title: ✨ Features
sections.content:
✅ YouTube Comment Analysis
✅ Reddit Discussion Analysis
✅ Real-Time Sentiment Analysis

sections.title: 🔐 User Authentication
sections.content: Uses JWT authentication and Google OAuth login with a random password generator.

sections.title: 🎨 Frontend Overview
sections.content: Built with React.js, Axios, and React Router for smooth navigation.

sections.title: 🚀 Deployment
sections.content: Backend is hosted on Vercel, and the frontend is deployed on Netlify.

sections.title: 📝 Environment Variables
sections.content: Set up API keys and secrets in the `.env` file.

sections.title: 💻 Tech Stack
sections.content: FastAPI, React.js, MongoDB, and NLP libraries power the platform.

sections.title: ❓ FAQ
sections.content: Can I analyze private YouTube videos? No, only public videos are supported.

authentication: POST /auth/login  // Login and get JWT token
